item.title: 6 Best Strategy Games With Simple Controls
item.description:
Summary

  • Strategy games with simple controls offer accessible experiences without skimping on gameplay.
  • Dungeon Of The Endless, Tinyfolks, and StarVaders provide satisfying but accessible gameplay experiences.
  • Tooth & Tail, Shogun Showdown, and Balatro simplify complex mechanics for streamlined strategic gameplay.

Strategy games are typically known for their complex mechanics and, often in the case of real-time variants, rather overwhelming control schemes. Dozens of keyboard shortcuts are commonplace in the RTS genre in particular. While they offer opportunities for player expression, complex controls can hurt a game's accessibility.

This also applies to turn-based strategy games, where an abundance of options or a cluttered user interface can spell doom for the learning process. These strategy games, however, feature simple controls without skimping on the gameplay, offering satisfying but accessible experiences.

6 Dungeon Of The Endless

A Simple Combination Of Strategy & Resource Management

Dungeon of the Endless
7.0 /10
Released
December 11, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen
Powered by

Dungeon of the Endless is a dark and atmospheric sci-fi dungeon-crawler with a gritty pixel-art aesthetic. In the game, players battle through a series of labyrinthine rooms and halls as they attempt to escort a valuable crystal through a sci-fi dungeon.

To do this, players must efficiently manage a party of heroes and the resources they have on hand. Thanks to a heavier focus on resource management and tower defense, Dungeon of the Endless manages to remain a strategic experience while maintaining simple controls.

5 Tinyfolks

A Minimalist Strategy RPG

Tinyfolks
RPG
Tactical
Strategy
Systems
Released
June 1, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Tinyfolks is a simple but strategic RPG that excels with its charming pixel-art visuals and buoyant chip-tune soundtrack. Best of all, Tinyfolks provides an experience that borrows heavily from Darkest Dungeon but offers a more forgiving approach to design, allowing for accessible gameplay and simple controls.

In the game, players control a small party of adventurers in turn-based combat, working their way through a series of dungeon crawls, each with their own unique boss battles. Thankfully, Tinyfolks keeps its interface easy to read and its abilities easy to grasp, allowing player interactions to remain simple despite the strategic gameplay that's present.

4 StarVaders

An Intuitive Deck-Builder

6 Images
6 Images
StarVaders
Roguelike
Deckbuilding
Systems
Released
April 30, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

This turn-based roguelike deck-builder stands out with its slick and stylish art style as much as its elegant game design. In StarVaders, players control a mech as they defend against a variety of alien invaders using a variety of simple cards.

Since players have control over a character, these cards are necessary for moving around. However, thanks to the deck-building gameplay, every action is done through card interactions, and so the controls remain tremendously simple.

3 Tooth & Tail

An Accessible RTS

Tooth and Tail
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 80 /100 Critics Rec: 88%
Released
September 12, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4
Powered by

Tooth & Tail is a remarkably charming and streamlined real-time strategy game that champions simplicity. This innovative title strips back typical RTS mechanics and simplifies player controls to offer an accessible experience.

However, Tooth & Tail is far from a watered-down game, maintaining much of the genre's patented blend of base-building, unit production, and management. The variety of units and structures, along with the unique and intuitive control method, ensures that Tooth & Tail is both a worthwhile and welcoming experience.

2 Shogun Showdown

Action-Packed Tactics

Shogun Showdown
10.0 /10
Released
September 5, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood
Powered by

Shogun Showdown is an elegant and action-packed roguelike deck-builder that allows for player interaction and strategy via a set of simple tiles. These tiles allow players to move around the board on a single axis while unleashing often devastating attacks on their foes. Deck-building elements keep this strategic, but the control is elegant and simple.

This is primarily thanks to a simple user interface and truly refined tiles that never give the player too much information to digest. Furthermore, enemy intentions are well telegraphed, ensuring players are always able to make informed decisions.

1 Thronefall

A Minimalist Combination Of Tower Defense & RTS

Thronefall
Strategy
City Builder
Systems
Released
October 11, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Thronefall is a minimalist combination of base defense and real-time strategy, offering players an accessible yet strategic experience with simple controls. By streamlining genre trends such as unit production and management, Thronefall offers players a fluid and frustration-free experience that still provides frequent challenges.

In the game, players take control of a maneuverable character that can be used to navigate each level. This allows players to freely explore and intuitively construct new defenses and economic structures, while also engaging in combat themselves. The simplified RTS mechanics are also tremendous, allowing players to command small armies with very little input.

item.title: Fallout: New Vegas Player Shares Little-Known Trick
item.description:
Fallout: New Vegas has a somewhat hidden trick for dealing with Caesar's Legion at Cottonwood Cove by overwhelming local legionaries with radioactive barrels. This easy-to-miss detail has recently surprised even some longstanding Fallout: New Vegas fans.

The only entry in the Fallout franchise made by Obsidian Entertainment will celebrate its 15th anniversary on October 19. Despite being a decade and a half old, Fallout: New Vegas still enjoys an active player community, with just its Steam version peaking at over 5,000 concurrent users on June 22.

In the latest testament to the game's replayability, some Fallout: New Vegas fans were recently surprised to learn that there's an easier way of dealing with Caesar's Legion at Cottonwood Cove than simply charging the local patrols. As highlighted by Reddit user Vile35, most of the enemies in this area can be neutralized by unlocking a decrepit truck positioned at Cottonwood Overlook—a fittingly named location that sits above the cove. Doing so releases a cascade of radioactive waste barrels, quickly eliminating the legionaries below.

Vile35's tip amassed nearly 4,000 upvotes within hours of going live in late June 2025, quickly reaching the front page of the r/Fallout subreddit. Even some self-described Fallout: New Vegas veterans chiming in on this discovery admitted they were unaware of this alternative approach to Cottonwood Cove, expressing admiration that the game is still finding ways to surprise them nearly 15 years following its original release.

Fallout: NV's Cottonwood Overlook Barrel Trick Has a Skill Requirement

What Vile35's gameplay footage doesn't make it clear is that unleashing radioactive waste onto Cottonwood Cove comes with a requirement of at least level 50 in the Fallout: New Vegas Lockpick skill. High-Perception builds should have little trouble meeting this threshold, while others can rely on clothing bonuses and temporary PER boosts from consumables like Mentats to unlock the derelict truck carrying the deadly cargo.

Unleashing the barrels triggers a scripted sequence in which even Legionaries not initially near the overlook begin rushing toward the player's location. Most—or all—of them die in the process, a spectacle that can be safely observed from a distance. While Cursor Lucullus, Caesar’s Legion ferryman, typically survives this ordeal, players can still reach Caesar's fort without him by interacting with the raft at the end of the cove’s dock.

item.title: Final Fantasy 9's Rumored Remake May Miss The Boat, With An Asterisk Attached
item.description:
On July 7, Final Fantasy 9 will turn 25 years old. In the lead-up to the anniversary, Square Enix has released celebratory merchandise, including two character figurines and new T-shirts. Yet the one thing many fans have been anticipating for years remains noticeably absent: confirmation of the long-rumored remake.

Although the remake has never been officially announced, Final Fantasy 9 ’s remake existence has been heavily hinted at through NVIDIA leaks, developer resumes, and industry insiders. It remains one of the worst-kept secrets in recent memory. Despite that, with the 25th anniversary not far away and no major announcement yet, the chance to make the remake part of the celebration may be slipping away—unless Square Enix has something bold planned.

Final Fantasy 9 Remake Deserves a Thoughtful Approach

The heart of Final Fantasy 9 lies in its character-driven plot, turn-based battles, and theatrical tone. FF9 's Zidane, Vivi, and Garnet aren’t just heroes with tragic pasts; they embody archetypes from classic fantasy, brought to life with warmth and sincerity. Any remake that discards this tone for spectacle would miss the point entirely. The game’s original ATB system, town design, and thematic pacing must be respected in a hypothetical remake, even if visuals and menus are modernized.

One key narrative thread fans still debate today is Vivi’s fate at the end of FF9 , and a remake could offer clarity or emotional expansion without undermining the ambiguity that made it so memorable.

Final Fantasy 9’s Anniversary Plans Raise Questions

With only two weeks until the 25th anniversary, Square Enix has been unusually quiet. A special anniversary website was launched, and merchandise continues to trickle in, but no game announcements have been tied to the occasion. In contrast, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth had months of trailers and previews before launch. The silence surrounding Final Fantasy 9 feels intentional, and not in a good way.

There is, however, a possibility that Square Enix is planning a shadow drop. This approach has become more common in recent months as Final Fantasy 16 recently shadow-dropped on Xbox, and other developers have seen success dropping titles with minimal warning. A Final Fantasy 9 remake could benefit from that surprise factor, especially if it arrives during a celebratory livestream or fan event.

Still, the odds are thinning. A shadow drop would be exciting, but Square Enix typically promotes its major projects with long marketing cycles. Unless a reveal is imminent, it's hard to imagine a full remake arriving this July. The company may instead be holding it for a later release window and, if so, risks missing out on the symbolic resonance of the 25th anniversary.

It’s worth mentioning that Square Enix has yet to deliver a full remake or modern version of Final Fantasy 6 , a game equally revered. That delay may point to a broader challenge in updating older titles without alienating their core identity.

A Final Fantasy 9 Remake Still Feels Necessary

Even if a remake doesn't arrive this July, it still feels like an essential move for some point in the future. The current-gen version of Final Fantasy 9 is a lightly enhanced remaster, but it lacks polish. The character models look out of place against blurry pre-rendered backgrounds, and the few improvements to speed and combat don’t go far enough.

Other remasters, such as Final Fantasy 10 HD , have aged far better. That makes the current state of Final Fantasy 9 all the more frustrating. Despite its strong narrative and timeless charm, the presentation is difficult to recommend to new players. Therefore, a remake would allow Square Enix to reintroduce the game to a wider audience without compromising its identity.

Unlike Final Fantasy 7 Remake , this is not a remake that should include alternate timelines, fate, or flashy reinterpretations. It needs careful restoration, and a remake that retains the original’s tone, updates its visuals, and polishes the systems could finally give Final Fantasy 9 the legacy treatment it deserves. Even if the anniversary passes without fanfare, demand will not have gone away.

item.title: Survival Crafting Game With Very Positive Reviews Is Free to Play This Weekend
item.description:
Players have until the end of the weekend to try out indie survival game Len's Island for free. AAA games are usually developed by hundreds or thousands of people with significant resources, so they're able to deliver grandiose experiences. On the other hand, indie games are created on a much smaller scale, but they can offer gamers experiences that are just as great — and some would even argue even better. Stardew Valley , Celeste , and Undertale are just some of the most well-known names in the indie games scene, and they've practically become household names among those in the gaming community.

Indie game developers have shown time and again that they're able to come up with delightfully unique ideas, which is why some players prefer these smaller creators and studios. Additionally, fans tend to stick to creators on a deeper personal level, as they can truly recognize their ideas, effort, and humility. This is why Haunted Chocolatier already has such a huge following despite being far from its release; the fans saw how well Eric Barone, also known as ConcernedApe, handled Stardew Valley and look forward to continuously supporting his work.

There are thousands of indie developers in the gaming industry, and it can be hard to stand out due to this saturation, making promotional campaigns especially important during critical phases of development. This is why Flow Studio is giving players the opportunity to freely try out its game, Len's Island , until Monday, June 23, at 12 PM ET. Alongside the full launch of the game, the creator wants players to give the game a fair shake before deciding if they'll buy it.

Len's Island Available for Free on Steam for a Limited Time

In Len's Island , players get to control a shoeless character on an island and attempt to survive. They must build a shelter, feed themselves by hunting and farming, and explore dangerous dungeons. They can trade with townsfolk and play alongside their friends, as it supports multiplayer up to eight players. Therefore, gamers can enjoy their time with Len's Island on their own or try it out with friends so they can watch each other's backs while exploring the procedurally generated world.

Players can enjoy a significant portion of the game during the free trial, and if they want to continue the story or simply want access to it at all times, they can pick up where they left off after purchasing. Len's Island will be available at a discount price on Steam until July 3.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Spiral Abyss for Version 5.8
item.description:
Recent datamining from the Genshin Impact beta servers has revealed a detailed overview of the upcoming Spiral Abyss from Version 5.8, featuring a focus on Lunar-Charged and Nightsoul DMG. While the Stygian Onslaught and the Imaginarium Theater have added to the endgame experience in Genshin Impact , the Spiral Abyss remains its core. It puts the player's skill to the test and often requires them to invest in characters from the current Event Banners.

Though the Spiral Abyss in Genshin Impact has evolved with the game itself, many players feel that the hit point inflation on Floor 12 has gone overboard in the Natlan era. Compared to Version 4.8, Version 5.8 has an increase of 88.35% in total hit points on Floor 12, requiring players to deal almost twice as much damage to clear in time. While the reintroduction of Ley Line Disorders to Floor 12 has allowed players to close the gap, the blessings are designed in a way that solely benefits currently featured 5-Star characters.

According to HomDGCat, Version 5.8 will primarily be designed with Ineffa in mind, featuring both a Lunar-Charged blessing and the new Electro-Charged world boss. The second half will once again benefit Melt teams from Natlan, but Varesa in an Overload team should also do well. The first half may be doable with Neuvillette, as many of its chambers will feature multiple enemies per wave. In terms of how this aligns with the Event Banners in Version 5.8 of Genshin Impact , both Citlali and Chasca are potential pieces of a Melt team.

Genshin Impact: Spiral Abyss for Version 5.8

Blessings

  • First Half
    • Characters' Electro-Charged and Lunar-Charged DMG increased by 75%.

  • Second Half
    • Characters' Nightsoul-aligned DMG dealt to opponents will be increased by 75%.

Chamber #1

  • First Half
    • Eremite Desert Clearwater (x4)
    • Eremite Sunfront (x2)
    • Eremite Daythunder (x2)
    • Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer (x2)
    • Eremite Stone Enchanter (x2)

  • Second Half
    • Fluid Avatar of Lava (x1)
    • Gluttonous Yumkasaur Mountain King (x1)

Chamber #2

  • First Half
    • Ruin Scout (x4)
    • Ruin Cruiser (x3)
    • Ruin Destroyer (x2)
    • Ruin Drake: Earthguard (x3)

  • Second Half
    • Burning-Aflame Wayob Manifestation (x1)
    • Jadeplume Terrorshroom (x1)

Chamber #3

  • First Half
    • Eremite Desert Clearwater (x4)
    • Eremite Sunfront (x2)
    • Eremite Daythunder (x2)
    • Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer (x2)
    • Eremite Stone Enchanter (x2).

  • Second Half
    • Embodiment of Tenochtzitoc (x1)
    • Secret Source Automaton: Configuration Device (x1)

Curiously, the community views this Spiral Abyss as being easier than the last few cycles. From the second half of April, Genshin Impact heavily promoted Freeze teams in the Spiral Abyss, which meant that players who invested in Escoffier had a much easier time than those who did not. The second half of August will be the first time in four months that Freeze teams in Genshin Impact won't have an advantage in the Spiral Abyss, allowing other playstyles to shine once again.

The Spiral Abyss in Version 5.8 will last until September 16, 2025, which will overlap with the launch of Nod-Krai. While no characters have been confirmed by official sources, the latest leaks point towards a 5-Star Male Electro character and a 5-Star Female Geo character joining the roster in Version 6.0. Players will be able to find out more about them in July 2025, as marketing for Nod-Krai in Genshin Impact is expected to ramp up in the coming weeks. Version 5.8 is set to launch on July 30, 2025.
